tab_content.accordion_title: Can I talk to a doctor on Maple about my snoring?
tab_content.accordion_intro: Yes, absolutely. In most cases, a Maple doctor can diagnose snoring online by asking about your symptoms and observing your condition. Once you describe your symptoms to the doctor, they’ll be able to provide a diagnosis, write necessary prescriptions, and recommend an appropriate course of treatment. If the doctor suspects you have a more serious problem, they may suggest for you to go to a clinic for a thorough physical examination.
tab_content.accordion_content: In select provinces, you can also request to see a sleep therapist right on Maple about your snoring. To learn more about how our online sleep therapy assessments work, please click here.

tab_content.accordion_title: Can I get a prescription on Maple?
tab_content.accordion_intro: Yes, our physicians can prescribe medications online during your consultation. Once you accept a prescription, you’ll have the option to pick it up from any pharmacy or to have it delivered right to your door at no additional cost.
tab_content.accordion_content: You can visit our How it Works page to learn more.

tab_content.accordion_intro: Snoring can occur as you’re breathing during sleep. Snoring is caused by air not being able to move freely through the nose or mouth, resulting in the tissues around this area vibrating as you breathe.
tab_content.accordion_content: Snoring may also be triggered by various external factors such as allergies, alcohol consumption, cold, fever, weight fluctuations and more. These factors can all cause airways to become narrower, causing increased tissue vibration, making the snoring either begin or increase in volume.

tab_content.accordion_intro: Each case of snoring is different , so it’s best to speak with a doctor or sleep therapist — they’ll be able to provide you with possible treatment options.

With Maple, you can start consulting with a doctor about your symptoms in a matter of minutes. We’re a healthcare app for fast, convenient 24/7 access to Canadian doctors.

You simply log in, tap a button to request a consultation, and we’ll immediately connect you to a doctor via live chat or video. You can visit our How it Works page to learn more.

Our doctors can assess symptoms, and provide treatment, including prescriptions as necessary.
tab_content.accordion_content: Additionally, for select provinces, you may see a dermatologist on Maple about your pigment disorder the same way you would request a consultation with a general practitioner. Maple’s dermatologists are able to provide you with a diagnosis, necessary notes, treatment plans, and prescriptions within 24 hours.
